cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 380 miles SE of Miami Florida

motion.direction: W (expected to turn WNW then NW)

cyclone.trajectory: tracking WNW today, then turning NW Saturday and moving directly toward the Florida Keys and the south-central Florida peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Upper Florida Keys / extreme South Florida coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch north of Jupiter Inlet to Flagler/Volusia County Line and north of Bonita Beach to Anclote River; Storm Surge Watch north of Sebastian Inlet to Ponce Inlet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Jupiter Inlet southward around Florida peninsula to Bonita Beach, including the Florida Keys, Lake Okeechobee and Florida Bay; Storm Surge Warning Sebastian Inlet southward around the Florida peninsula to Venice including the Keys
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Florida coast including Miami-Dade and Broward counties, the Florida Keys, and immediate coastal waters
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds expected to begin late Saturday with hurricane-force gusts possible early Sunday as Irma nears; sustained winds could exceed 74 mph if the core tracks over or just west of PortMiami.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge inundation of 5–10 ft above ground level possible along Biscayne Bay shoreline including PortMiami if the peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–15 inches with isolated totals up to 20 inches possible, producing flash flooding on terminal areas and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large destructive waves, dangerous rip currents, and possible tornadoes embedded in outer rainbands could disrupt cargo handling and vessel movements.
